and stores random numbers in a RANDAO manner (and controls when they are revealed by AuRa validators) and accumulates a random seed. The random seed is used to form a new validator set by the `ValidatorSetAuRa.newValidatorSet` function.","methods":{"clearCommit(uint256)":{"details":"Clears commit and cipher for the given validator's pool if the pool hasn't yet revealed their number. Called by the ValidatorSetAuRa.changeMiningAddress function when a validator creates a request to change their mining address."},"commitHash(bytes32,bytes)":{"details":"Called by the validator's node to store a hash and a cipher of the validator's number on each collection round. The validator's node must use its mining address to call this function. This function can only be called once per collection round (during the `commits phase`).","params":{"_cipher":"The cipher of the validator's number. Can be used by the node to restore the lost number after the node is restarted (see the `getCipher` getter).","_numberHash":"The Keccak-256 hash of the validator's number."}},"commitHashCallable(address,bytes32)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag of whether the `commitHash` function can be called at the current block by the specified validator. Used by the `commitHash` function and the `TxPermission` contract.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the validator which tries to call the `commitHash` function.","_numberHash":"The Keccak-256 hash of validator's number passed to the `commitHash` function."}},"commitPhaseLength()":{"details":"Returns the length of the commits/reveals phase which is always half of the collection round length."},"currentCollectRound()":{"details":"Returns the serial number of the current collection round."},"currentCollectRoundStartBlock()":{"details":"Returns the number of the first block of the current collection round."},"getCipher(uint256,address)":{"details":"Returns the cipher of the validator's number for the specified collection round and the specified validator stored by the validator through the `commitHash` function. For the past collection rounds the cipher is empty as it's erased by the internal `_clearOldCiphers` function.","params":{"_collectRound":"The serial number of the collection round for which the cipher should be retrieved.","_miningAddress":"The mining address of validator."}},"getCommit(uint256,address)":{"details":"Returns the Keccak-256 hash of the validator's number for the specified collection round and the specified validator stored by the validator through the `commitHash` function. Note that for the past collection rounds it can return empty results because there was a migration from mining addresses to staking addresses.","params":{"_collectRound":"The serial number of the collection round for which the hash should be retrieved.","_miningAddress":"The mining address of validator."}},"getCommitAndCipher(uint256,address)":{"details":"Returns the Keccak-256 hash and cipher of the validator's number for the specified collection round and the specified validator stored by the validator through the `commitHash` function. For the past collection rounds the cipher is empty. Note that for the past collection rounds it can return empty results because there was a migration from mining addresses to staking addresses.","params":{"_collectRound":"The serial number of the collection round for which hash and cipher should be retrieved.","_miningAddress":"The mining address of validator."}},"initialize(uint256,address,bool)":{"details":"Initializes the contract at network startup. Can only be called by the constructor of the `InitializerAuRa` contract or owner.","params":{"_collectRoundLength":"The length of a collection round in blocks.","_punishForUnreveal":"A boolean flag defining whether to punish validators for unrevealing.","_validatorSet":"The address of the `ValidatorSet` contract."}},"isCommitPhase()":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the current phase of the current collection round is a `commits phase`. Used by the validator's node to determine if it should commit the hash of the number during the current collection round."},"isCommitted(uint256,address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator has committed their number's hash for the specified collection round. Note that for the past collection rounds it can return false-negative results because there was a migration from mining addresses to staking addresses (on etl chain). Also, it intentionally returns a false-positive result during the commit phase when the specified mining address of a validator is about to be changed. This is needed to prevent committing hash/cipher pair by Ethereum node to guarantee that a new validator's node (with a new mining address) won't try to wrongly decrypt the cipher stored by the previous node (created by the private key of the previous mining address).","params":{"_collectRound":"The serial number of the collection round for which the checkup should be done.","_miningAddress":"The mining address of the validator."}},"isInitialized()":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called."},"isRevealPhase()":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the current phase of the current collection round is a `reveals phase`. This function does nothing if the current block is not the last block of the current collection round. Can only be called by the `BlockRewardAuRa` contract (by its `reward` function)."},"revealNumber(uint256)":{"details":"Called by the validator's node to XOR its number with the current random seed. owner."}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/RandomAuRa.sol":"RandomAuRa"},"evmVersion":"petersburg","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/RandomAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8418a5d483530c9e62dc95cecf9d3a2efb10f576b2b4a3b08b633f0a32f6caa7","urls":["bzzr://e47db1c4f3c62953515e501d1d4a6a666c3b115a768215c74a19bd0c5817f1a7","dweb:/ipfs/QmaoQn9NPxfFjQi15kWMVBh7vwLxfgyaYq72JsGrdDGLzM"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/interfaces/IRandomAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0x66b431bcbdd999c013b0223ca0c8feb88674d90ecf68a1ccc59419c033c0c21b","urls":["bzzr://36604bbf54eb2220468856bb229b06caca862d6e9b69bbaf8733f53ec2ab4dd1","dweb:/ipfs/QmVd3RFu4nr482o1UVGPdRXRzippd5iWyif7MPUw4hiEiP"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/interfaces/IStakingAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa36b58120690351c3172ae2f9c07fa249df40461e59025a5a2c152e22235d502","urls":["bzzr://6096df19862e816f1f3e2717d5bc0a7a827f74df6a36c6505875f5ae08306a4f","dweb:/ipfs/QmavHRDv8H4t1S2vhh9aBic5U7fpSssMqS61mg8VpTJdtu"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/interfaces/IValidatorSetAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1fe05324cb277b4163cad2ce957c20806544a550832161676c067ef21b8075ac","urls":["bzzr://831ff6e500e6d4e164d066b4e1d4d3946e1ee9b1980125835e8b4f952d811faf","dweb:/ipfs/Qmf5nFvaBT1baMMykiNFkQ15xqg1PQzkWj9g1bThuja9yS"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/upgradeability/UpgradeabilityAdmin.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9addb17fda1bc4c4f8ba64e929be2acdb29472f9d3cfe18491852c0617d20169","urls":["bzzr://c0af15280f0b0edeedb355bea94acfaa3142e361b61f8356937ca1b039f131dd","dweb:/ipfs/QmRmtnWMBvXYFBNppWcEdVTakMwPgqB4JhnXgMuT48yEou"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documen @dev Clears commit and cipher for the given validator's pool if the pool

 when a validator creates a request to change their mining address.

@dev Checks whether the current validators at the end of each collection round revealed their numbers,
 and removes malicious validators if needed.
 This function does nothing if the current block is not the last block of the current collection round.
 Can only be called by the `BlockRewardAuRa` contract (by its `reward` function).

devdoc.details: Generates and stores random numbers in a RANDAO manner (and controls when they are revealed by AuRa validators) and accumulates a random seed. The random seed is used to form a new validator set by the `ValidatorSetAuRa.newValidatorSet` function.

clearCommit(uint256).details: Clears commit and cipher for the given validator's pool if the pool hasn't yet revealed their number. Called by the ValidatorSetAuRa.changeMiningAddress function when a validator creates a request to change their mining address.

commitHash(bytes32,bytes).details: Called by the validator's node to store a hash and a cipher of the validator's number on each collection round. The validator's node must use its mining address to call this function. This function can only be called once per collection round (during the `commits phase`).

params._cipher: The cipher of the validator's number. Can be used by the node to restore the lost number after the node is restarted (see the `getCipher` getter).
params._numberHash: The Keccak-256 hash of the validator's number.

commitHashCallable(address,bytes32).details: Returns a boolean flag of whether the `commitHash` function can be called at the current block by the specified validator. Used by the `commitHash` function and the `TxPermission` contract.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the validator which tries to call the `commitHash` function.
params._numberHash: The Keccak-256 hash of validator's number passed to the `commitHash` function.

commitPhaseLength().details: Returns the length of the commits/reveals phase which is always half of the collection round length.

currentCollectRound().details: Returns the serial number of the current collection round.

currentCollectRoundStartBlock().details: Returns the number of the first block of the current collection round.

getCipher(uint256,address).details: Returns the cipher of the validator's number for the specified collection round and the specified validator stored by the validator through the `commitHash` function. For the past collection rounds the cipher is empty as it's erased by the internal `_clearOldCiphers` function.

params._collectRound: The serial number of the collection round for which the cipher should be retrieved.

getCommit(uint256,address).details: Returns the Keccak-256 hash of the validator's number for the specified collection round and the specified validator stored by the validator through the `commitHash` function. Note that for the past collection rounds it can return empty results because there was a migration from mining addresses to staking addresses.

params._collectRound: The serial number of the collection round for which the hash should be retrieved.

getCommitAndCipher(uint256,address).details: Returns the Keccak-256 hash and cipher of the validator's number for the specified collection round and the specified validator stored by the validator through the `commitHash` function. For the past collection rounds the cipher is empty. Note that for the past collection rounds it can return empty results because there was a migration from mining addresses to staking addresses.

params._collectRound: The serial number of the collection round for which hash and cipher should be retrieved.

initialize(uint256,address,bool).details: Initializes the contract at network startup. Can only be called by the constructor of the `InitializerAuRa` contract or owner.

params._collectRoundLength: The length of a collection round in blocks.
params._punishForUnreveal: A boolean flag defining whether to punish validators for unrevealing.

isCommitPhase().details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the current phase of the current collection round is a `commits phase`. Used by the validator's node to determine if it should commit the hash of the number during the current collection round.

isCommitted(uint256,address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator has committed their number's hash for the specified collection round. Note that for the past collection rounds it can return false-negative results because there was a migration from mining addresses to staking addresses (on etl chain). Also, it intentionally returns a false-positive result during the commit phase when the specified mining address of a validator is about to be changed. This is needed to prevent committing hash/cipher pair by Ethereum node to guarantee that a new validator's node (with a new mining address) won't try to wrongly decrypt the cipher stored by the previous node (created by the private key of the previous mining address).

params._collectRound: The serial number of the collection round for which the checkup should be done.
params._miningAddress: The mining address of the validator.

isInitialized().details: Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called.

isRevealPhase().details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the current phase of the current collection round is a `reveals phase`. Used by the validator's node to determine if it should reveal the number during the current collection round.

nextCollectRoundStartBlock().details: Returns the number of the first block of the next (future) collection round.

nextCommitPhaseStartBlock().details: Returns the number of the first block of the next (future) commit phase.

nextRevealPhaseStartBlock().details: Returns the number of the first block of the next (future) reveal phase.

onFinishCollectRound().details: Checks whether the current validators at the end of each collection round revealed their numbers, and removes malicious validators if needed. This function does nothing if the current block is not the last block of the current collection round. Can only be called by the `BlockRewardAuRa` contract (by its `reward` function).

revealNumber(uint256).details: Called by the validator's node to XOR its number with the current random seed. The validator's node must use its mining address to call this function. This function can only be called once per collection round (during the `reveals phase`).

revealNumberCallable(address,uint256).details: Returns a boolean flag of whether the `revealNumber` function can be called at the current block by the specified validator. Used by the `revealNumber` function and the `TxPermission` contract.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of validator which tries to call the `revealNumber` function.
params._number: The validator's number passed to the `revealNumber` function.

revealSecret(uint256).details: The same as the `revealNumber` function (see its description). The `revealSecret` was renamed to `revealNumber`, so this function is left for backward compatibility with the previous client implementation and should be deleted in the future.

revealSecretCallable(address,uint256).details: The same as the `revealNumberCallable` getter (see its description). The `revealSecretCallable` was renamed to `revealNumberCallable`, so this function is left for backward compatibility with the previous client implementation and should be deleted in the future.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of validator which tries to call the `revealSecret` function.
params._number: The validator's number passed to the `revealSecret` function.

revealSkips(uint256,address).details: Returns the number of reveal skips made by the specified validator during the specified staking epoch.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the validator.

sentReveal(uint256,address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator has revealed their number for the specified collection round. Note that for the past collection rounds it can return false-negative results because there was a migration from mining addresses to staking addresses.

params._collectRound: The serial number of the collection round for which the checkup should be done.
params._miningAddress: The mining address of the validator.

setPunishForUnreveal(bool).details: Changes the `punishForUnreveal` boolean flag. Can only be called by an owner.
